sentences.en: A bluish mist hung in the air.
sentences.cn: 一层淡蓝色的薄雾弥漫在空中。

sentences.en: A milky mist filled the valley.
sentences.cn: 白蒙蒙的薄雾弥漫山谷。

sentences.en: Amid the trees the sea mist was dripping.
sentences.cn: 林子里弥漫着湿漉漉的海雾。

sentences.en: As the mist cleared, the house came into sight bit by bit.
sentences.cn: 随着雾散天晴, 房舍逐渐呈现在眼前.

sentences.en: He recognized the coast of England through a veil of mist.
sentences.cn: 透过薄雾他认出了那是英格兰的海岸线。

sentences.en: He vanished into the mist.
sentences.cn: 他消失在雾中。

sentences.en: I stepped outside and pulled up my collar against the cold mist.
sentences.cn: 我走出门，竖起衣领抵御冷雾。

sentences.en: It is difficult to shine a light through its this thick mist.
sentences.cn: 光线很难穿透这么浓的雾.

sentences.en: Mist had crept in again from the sea.
sentences.cn: 薄雾又从海面上弥漫过来了。

sentences.en: Mist hovered in all the valleys.
sentences.cn: 所有的山谷都笼罩着一层雾气。

sentences.en: Mist shrouded the outline of Buckingham Palace.
sentences.cn: 雾霭蒙蒙，白金汉宫若隐若现。

sentences.en: The beautiful sweeping coastline was cloaked in mist.
sentences.cn: 美丽的海岸线一望无际，笼罩在迷雾之中。

sentences.en: The hills were shrouded in mist .
sentences.cn: 这些小山被笼罩在薄雾之中。

sentences.en: The hills were shrouded in mist (= covered in mist, so that you could not see them ) .
sentences.cn: 山峦笼罩在雾霭之中。

sentences.en: The houses appeared as a blur in the mist.
sentences.cn: 房子在薄雾中隐隐约约看不清.

sentences.en: The mist came down off the mountains.
sentences.cn: 雾从山上飘下来。

sentences.en: The mists rolled in off the sea (= came on to the land from the sea ) .
sentences.cn: 雾气从海上涌来。

sentences.en: The mountain tops were wreathed in mist.
sentences.cn: 山顶笼罩在薄雾之中。

sentences.en: The windows misted, blurring the stark streetlight.
sentences.cn: 窗户蒙上了一层水汽，使得明亮的街灯模糊了。

sentences.en: We could just see the outline of the house through the mist.
sentences.cn: 薄雾中我们只能看到房子的轮廓。

sentences.en: With a thick mist now blanketing the trees, I got thoroughly lost.
sentences.cn: 此时浓雾笼罩着林木，我彻底迷路了。

words.tran_cn: 雾浓地；朦胧地，不清楚地

trans.tran_cn: 薄雾，视线模糊不清，液体喷雾
trans.tran_en: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far
If a piece of glass mists or is misted, it becomes covered with tiny drops of moisture, so that you cannot see through it easily
